title: Can I build a business website using WordPress? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. And it’s definitely a safe bet. About 70% of all websites are built with WordPress. WordPress is the leading content management system out there in basically any industry. Emerged as a basic CMS for blogging, it evolved into a powerful publishing tool for any kind of website. When launching a company website on WordPress I recommend to consider the following things: Performance: WordPress offers some standard performance optimization. However, I’d recommend checking some SEO & caching plugins to optimize your website for speed (Google & your users will love it). Standard WordPress plugins: There are many great and mighty WordPress plugins out there for improving your websites. I particularly recommend these ones. As someone who’s using WordPress pretty heavily for years (for our company website + blog + personal blogs), it is definitely a low entry if you just need a basic website.

Of course, you can build a business website using WordPress! WordPress is a popular open-source content management system that accounts for a bulk of business websites online. Armed with a host of features to develop and customize a site, WordPress is very convenient to use. The themes are plenty and you can integrate a lot of plugins as per your wish. Once you are done developing the website, you can maintain it easily and without spending a lot of money. The super-active community of WordPress is always helping each other and they never cease to contribute. WordPress is updated on a regular basis and with each update, its interface becomes better. These reasons have made more and more businesses drift away from other CMS platforms and opt for WordPress website development.  If one has to rank WordPress in terms of SEO-friendliness, there is no doubt that it will leave many other content management systems far behind. When you have a business, you expect it to grow! And, as you grow your website will have to match that growth without any glitches. The scalability of WordPress is quite robust and since it had started as a blogging platform initially, it offers a wide range of blogging tools that you can utilize and customize your webpages. If you do not have the technical know-how to manage a CMS, you can always seek professional help to develop a great website for your business. Let’s hope that the answer helps you!

WordPress is an incredibly powerful content management system. Even if you're not technologically savvy, you can build any type of website in WordPress. It is especially useful in cases where it is desirable to launch a website without much effort. Log in and familiarize yourself with the dashboard. In order to stand out from the crowd, a website needs to bear its own identity both in terms of look and technicality. Because of the fact that the custom projects are the ones which enable you to display and articulate your ideas and specialties without any bar, they are always more preferable.

WordPress is a completely free, flexible and open source content management system that is used to power nearly 50% of all business websites online. It is user-friendly and good for both small and large website. Also, you can easily make your website responsive, which means that your site will work on tablets and mobiles, along with your desktop.  After you have chosen WordPress for creating your business website, there are only 2 more steps that you have to worry about. These are: Domain 	name and host 	– The domain name refers to the web address (http://yourwebsitename.com) and hosting is a service that is going to connect your website to 	the Internet. Even though the WordPress platform is free, domain 	name and hosting is going to cost you reasonably.Install 	WordPress – You need to use a one-click installation to create a 	website with WordPress. Once that is done, you can choose your own 	theme or template for your website. You can add pages and even edit 	content, add pages to the menu and so on. The customization and 	editing tools are endless, and you can make use of them to 	differentiate your business website from the rest.If you have any further query, you can always get in touch with a Wordpress website development company.

YES you can. There are a lot of free themes available for building a Business website using WordPress. My personal favorite among those free themes is ‘Sequential’ theme by Automattic (the makers of WordPress itself). Just a simple Google search can take you to a lot of these free themes. If you are willing to invest $30-$60 you can find thousands of premium themes on a theme market place like ‘Envato Theme Forest’. These premium themes usually offer more features and better support than the free themes. Its entirely your personal choice whether to go for a Free or a Premium theme.

If your knowledge of coding is mainly basic HTML and CSS, you can build your business website using WordPress or using a drag and drop WordPress page builder. Page builders allow you to customize much of your website without having to write complex coding yourself. Many of the domain name registrars will also offer email addresses for your business at an additional cost. While you are viewing the benefits of each registrar it is a good idea to see which email package fits what you require based on the number of accounts you can create and amount of storage you might need.

I believe so. It’s fairly easy to learn on your own. There’s TONS of how to videos & free courses out there. If you want to test it out, create a site with the .com site & get a feel for how it all works & get a feel how the admin section feels to you. Just be sure to use the .org version for your business website. It’s actually against WP’s TOS to commercialize the free sites built on the .com site. It also will give you a good place to introduce your business to the world ( as well as backlinks to your social media and eventually your website). Just leave it up once your site is finally built so there won’t be any broken links.
